summary: Email chain between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) regarding the preparation of briefing memos for a meeting with the Deputy Attorney General. The memos cover SDNY cases and recusal matters, with a specific mention that Epstein was added to the briefing materials.

persons.name: Geoffie Berman
persons.role: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of one of the memos being briefed to the Deputy Attorney General; his cases are included in the briefing materials.

connections.description: Berman, as US Attorney for SDNY, is briefing the Deputy Attorney General (Ed) on cases including Epstein.

events.title: Memo preparation for DAG briefing
events.description: Two memos were prepared and sent for a briefing with the Deputy Attorney General: one from Geoff Berman on SDNY cases and another on recusal matters, with Epstein added to the briefing.

events.title: Call to prep for DAG meeting
events.description: A call was held to walk through almost all the cases in both memos to prepare for the meeting with the Deputy Attorney General.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from May 2019 discussing briefing materials for the Deputy Attorney General.
Two memos were prepared: one on SDNY cases from US Attorney Geoff Berman and another on recusal matters.
Epstein was specifically added to the briefing materials after an initial discussion.
The preparation indicates high-level DOJ attention to SDNY cases, including Epstein, in May 2019.
